action.action-desc: Mr. Donovan (for himself, Mr. Payne, Mr. McCaul, and Mr. King of New York) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Homeland Security

form.official-title: To amend the Homeland Security Act of 2002 to authorize expenditures to combat emerging terrorist threats, including vehicular attacks, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Shielding Public Spaces from Vehicular Terrorism Act.
The Homeland Security Act of 2002 is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (11) of section 302 (6 U.S.C. 182), by inserting research and development to combat emerging terrorist threats, such as vehicular attacks, and before the long-term; and

subparagraph.text: in the matter preceding clause (i), by striking expertise in— and inserting expertise in the following:;
by redesignating clause (xiv) as clause (xv); and
by inserting after clause (xiii) the following new clause:

clause.text: Combatting emerging terrorist threats, including vehicular attacks.

section.text: Section 2008 of the Homeland Security Act of 2002 (6 U.S.C. 609) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by redesignating paragraphs (11) through (13) as (12) through (14), respectively; and
by inserting after paragraph (10) the following new paragraph:

paragraph.text: addressing security vulnerabilities of public spaces, including through the installation of bollards and other target hardening activities;
in subparagraph (B) of subsection (b)(3), by striking (a)(10) and inserting (a)(12).
